crystal Package¶

crystal Package¶

A module to specifically handle crystal structures

crystal.__init__.start()¶

This starts the crystal module ...

crystal_lattice_3d Module¶

crystal.crystal_lattice_3d.create_lattice_3d(lattice)¶

cubic_crystal_3d Module¶

crystal.cubic_crystal_3d.create_lattice_3d_with_planes(lattice, hklplanes)¶

lattice Module¶

The microstructure module define the class to handle 3D crystal lattices (the 7 Bravais lattices). This particular class has been largely inspired from the pymatgen project at https://github.com/materialsproject/pymatgen

class crystal.lattice.HklPlane(h, k, l)¶

This class define crystallographic planes using Miller indices. FIXME right now the we do not make use of the repiprocal lattice to compute the plane... this should be corrected in the future.

normal¶

Returns a copy of the unit vector normal to the plane.

class crystal.lattice.Lattice(matrix)¶

Crystal lattice class. It supports only cubic and hexagonal at the moment.

static cubic(a)¶

Create a cubic Lattice unit cell with length parameter a.

static from_parameters(a, b, c, alpha, beta, gamma)¶

Create a Lattice using unit cell lengths and angles (in degrees). Returns: A Lattice with the specified lattice parameters.

static hexagonal(a, c)¶

Create a hexagonal Lattice unit cell with length parameters a and c.

matrix¶

Returns a copy of matrix representing the Lattice.

static monoclinic(a, b, c, alpha)¶

Create a monoclinic Lattice unit cell with 3 different length parameters a, b and c. The cell angle is given by alpha.

static orthorombic(a, b, c)¶

Create a tetragonal Lattice unit cell with 3 different length parameters a, b and c.

static rhombohedral(a, alpha)¶

Create a rhombohedral Lattice unit cell with one length parameter a and the angle alpha.

static tetragonal(a, c)¶

Create a tetragonal Lattice unit cell with 2 different length parameters a and c.

static triclinic(a, b, c, alpha, beta, gamma)¶

Create a triclinic Lattice unit cell with 3 different length parameters a, b, c and three different cell angles alpha, beta and gamma. This method is here for the sake of completeness since one can create the triclinic cell directly using the from_parameters method.

volume()¶

Volume of the unit cell.

microstructure Module¶

The microstructure module provide elementary classes to describe a crystallographic granular microstructure such as mostly present in metallic materials.

class crystal.microstructure.EbsdMicrostructure(name='empty')¶

Class used to manipulate a full microstructure read from an EBSD measurement for instance.

extract_grains()¶
plot(type='Euler', save=False, display=True)¶
read_from_ebsd(filename, grid='square')¶
class crystal.microstructure.Grain(grain_id, grain_orientation)¶

Class defining a crystallographic grain.

A grain has its own crystallographic orientation. An optional id for the grain may be specified. The position field is the center of mass of the grain in world coordinates. The volume of the grain is expressed in pixel/voxel unit.

SetVtkMesh(mesh)¶
add_vtk_mesh(array)¶

class crystal.microstructure.Microstructure(name='empty')¶

Class used to manipulate a full microstructure.

It is typically defined as a list of grains objects.

SetVtkMesh(mesh)¶
